title: 110_hr5452
content: The Act titled "Coastal State Renewable Energy Promotion Act of 2008" amends the Coastal Zone Management Act of 1972 to include provisions for state surveys and planning related to ocean and coastal renewable energy sites. The Act allows grants to coastal States for surveys of coastal and Federal waters to identify areas suitable for renewable energy projects, considering hydrographic surveys, oceanographic observations, marine ecosystems, and existing marine uses. The Act allows grants to coastal States for surveys of coastal and Federal waters to identify areas suitable for renewable energy projects, including surveys of marine uses, shore locations, offshore locations, and other necessary matters. Coastal States are encouraged to facilitate participation from relevant agencies and stakeholders to develop comprehensive surveys. The Secretary will publish guidelines for grant application and usage within 180 days of enactment, with annual grants available for fiscal years 2009 through 2012. For fiscal years 2009 through 2012, the Secretary may grant up to $750,000 to coastal States for renewable energy surveys. Matching fund contributions are required after fiscal year 2011, with a 2-to-1 ratio for that year and a 1-to-1 ratio thereafter. The Secretary may grant up to $750,000 to coastal States for renewable energy surveys for fiscal years 2009 through 2012. Matching fund contributions are required with a 2-to-1 ratio for fiscal year 2011 and a 1-to-1 ratio for fiscal year 2012. After the initial grant, subsequent grants are contingent on satisfactory survey development. Coastal States are limited to receiving grants for a maximum of 3 fiscal years. The section does not grant new authority to coastal States or override existing Federal agency regulations on renewable energy facilities in outer Continental Shelf areas. The Secretary may grant funds to coastal States for renewable energy surveys, with matching fund contributions required. Priority consideration is given to suitable areas for renewable energy development, while unsuitable areas should be avoided. The Secretary shall provide technical assistance to coastal States for survey development and encourage other Federal agencies to assist. The Secretary may grant funds to coastal States for renewable energy surveys, with matching fund contributions required. Technical assistance will be provided to develop surveys, and other Federal agencies are encouraged to participate. Renewable energy is defined as wind, wave, current, tidal, or ocean thermal energy. Authorization of appropriations is amended to include necessary sums for grants under section 306B.
